results.title: Ideas for you
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Joe Scully
results.brief_description: Productivity ideas are vital to progress in Australian industry. Productivity groups of twelve or more meet regularly to exchange ideas. A new method of coating earth moving equipment, new fixing cement, a shortened cycle in washing machines, an insulated container for freighting dry ice, and a new method of packing poultry, are some results of the group’s activities.

results.title: Ideas at work
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates how skilled workers may be freed from unnecessary labour by the use of simple mechanical devices and for rearrangement of personnel. As the result of employee suggestions for improvements, labour and time saving devices are adopted, leading to increased production. Such increased productivity can lead to shorter hours and higher wages.

results.title: Idea >On!
results.brief_description:
One of 6 works selected by AIM director David Atkinson as representing the best interactive work produced by the AIM centre up until 2004. : Idea-ON>! presents the manifestation of fragments of Troy’s own personal reality in what appears to be a living, breathing world. The approach to multimedia rejects traditional flat user interface design, and offers the user many different forms of engagement through four new realities, each prototyping different aesthetic, structural and communication based approaches to virtual space. It is interactivity for interactivity’s sake, experimentation with what is possible, experience based as opposed to information based. Things may happen without user interaction, more obscure exploration may be required to find hidden places, or responses given by the objects and beings will vary, often following a surreal kind of logic.
A significant early work within the emergence of multimedia as art. Exhibited at Siggraph, BURNING THE INTERFACE: Museum of Contemprary Art, Sydney, Australia, 1996. PERSPECTA: Art Gallery of NSW, Sydney, Australia. ARS 95: Museum of Contemporary Art, Helsinki, Finland. Digital Salon: New York, USA 1995

results.title: Ida makes a movie
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America, Linda Schuyler and Kit Hood
results.brief_description: Ida decides to make a film about garbage and enter it in a children’s filmmaking festival. She receives a notice that her film has been selected as a finalist, but the jury has decided that Ida’s film is about war. She is in a dilemma - should she tell the awards committee the truth or remain silent? She decides to go to the awards and take her chances. When she wins first prize she steps forward and tells the audience and the judges the true story. Truth and Ida both win.

results.title: ICRC 1983
results.creator_credit: International Committee of the Red Cross
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of the work that was carried out world wide by the Red Cross in 1983. Shows volunteers and delegates at work in Africa, Poland, Middle East, Thailand, South America and Granada.

results.title: Icon
results.brief_description: A comedy about the gender of god and the real wishes of the Virgin Mary. Hugely successful, this one minute short has screened at festivals throughout Australia and Europe, and at the United Women’s Conference in Beijing.

results.title: ICI la France: Les Lyceens chez eux
results.creator_credit: Associated Television, Donald Carter and Mary Glasgow
results.brief_description: French language training film - all dialogue is in French. A visit to the modern Lycee at Enghien where the curriculum includes practical work, a lot of sport and where the pupils can pursue their own chosen activities such as painting as well as participating in the organisation of the school through an elected committee. Several pupils and teachers are introduced and a lesson Ronsard is shown.

results.title: ICI la France: L'heritage de Napoleon
results.creator_credit: Associated Television, Donald Carter and Mary Glasgow
results.brief_description: French language training film - all dialogue is in French. A visit to Prince Murat, a descendant of Napoleon, who describes Napoleon’s activities as an administrator, and creator of the Civil Code and the Legion d’Honneur. He also founded a boarding school at St Denis for daughters of members of the Legion d’Honneur. A visit to this school shows how the traditions established by Napoleon are still being maintained.

results.title: Ichabod and Mr Toad
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Walt Disney, James Algar, Clyde Geronimi and Jack Kinney
results.brief_description: Contains two classic Disney animated adaptations: Washington Irving’s ‘The Legend of Sleepy Hollow’ and Kenneth Grahame’s ‘The Wind in the willows’. These delightful stories feature the wonderful voices of Bing Crosby (narrator of the Legend of Sleepy Hollow) and Basil Rathbone (narrator of The Wind in the willows) supported by Eric Blore, Pat O’Malley, Colin Campbell, Campbell Grant and others.

results.title: Iceman
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Patrick Palmer, Norman Jewison and Fred Schepisi
results.brief_description: Drama about a team of Arctic researchers who find a 40,000 year old man frozen in ice and bring him back to life. The anthropologist wants to befriend him and learn about man’s past while the medical researchers want to discover the secret that will allow man to live in a frozen state. Stars Timothy Hutton, John Lone and Lindsay Crouse.
